title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a function that:
1. Fetches a random user from: https://randomuser.me/api/
2. Extracts the name (results[0].name.first)
3. Returns the name
4. Handles errors appropriately

Hint: The API returns { results: [{name: {first: 'John', last: 'Doe'}}] }
instructions:
Create a function that:
1. Fetches a random user from: https://randomuser.me/api/
2. Extracts the name (results[0].name.first)
3. Returns the name
4. Handles errors appropriately

Hint: The API returns { results: [{name: {first: 'John', last: 'Doe'}}] }

hints.text: let response = await fetch(url); let data = await response.json(); return data.results[0].name.first;

commonMistakes.consequence: response.json() returns a Promise, so without await you get a Promise object, not data.
commonMistakes.correction: Always await: let data = await response.json();

commonMistakes.consequence: fetch() doesn't throw on HTTP errors (404, 500), so you may try to parse an error page.
commonMistakes.correction: Check before parsing: if (!response.ok) throw new Error('HTTP error');
